publicwhip.spmotion: S1M-58 Fish processing industry (lodged on 18 June) Mr Brian Monteith*

*S1M-58 Mr David Davidson: That the Parliament agrees that the current expensive implementation proposals for the Urban Waste Water Treatment Directive (91/271/EEC), in so far as they apply to the Scottish fish processing industry in North East Scotland, will effectively close many of the companies engaged in the industry, which provide thousands of skilled jobs; and calls upon Scottish Ministers to seek to delay implementation of these proposals to allow for proper consideration of the technical review currently being undertaken to produce cost effective solutions for the industry, enabling the industry to continue as a major employer in Scotland. Supported by: Miss Annabel Goldie, Mr Nick Johnston, Alex Fergusson, Mr Murray Tosh, Alex Johnstone, Phil Gallie
S1M-58 Fish Processing Industry (lodged on 18 June 1999) Richard Lochhead*

S1M-58 Mr David Davidson: Fish processing industry—That the Parliament agrees that the current expensive implementation proposals for the Urban Waste Water Treatment Directive (91/271/EEC), in so far as they apply to the Scottish fish processing industry in North East Scotland, will effectively close many of the companies engaged in the industry, which provide thousands of skilled jobs; and also agrees that implementation of these proposals should be delayed to allow for proper consideration of the technical review currently being undertaken to produce cost effective solutions for the industry, enabling the industry to continue as a major employer in Scotland. (lodged on 18 June 1999) Supported by: Miss Annabel Goldie, Mr Nick Johnston, Alex Fergusson, Mr Murray Tosh, Alex Johnstone, Phil Gallie, Richard Lochhead, Irene McGugan
S1M-58 Fish processing industry (lodged on 18 June) Brian Adam*
